page.title: 09COMMUNITY
page.content: THE WEST HALL,SITUATED IN THE MIDDLE OF BARRY VILLAGE,WAS UNTIL 1945 THE PARISH CHURCH.NOW IT IS USED AS A CHURCH HALL, FOR GUIDES, BROWNIES, BEAVERS, CUBS AND SCOUTS. YOUTH ORGANISATIONS ARE THRIVING IN THIS SMALL COMMUNITY.THE BEAVERS, FIRST STARTED IN 1982, ARE NOW ONE OF THE LARGEST PARTS OF THE SCOUT MOVEMENT AND BARRY BEAVERS ARE VERY POPULAR WITH THE 6_8 YEAR OLD BOYS. THE BROWNIES HAVE HAD A VARIED PROGRAMME OF OUTDOOR EVENTS, AS HAVE THE GUIDES AND SCOUTS. THE HALL IS SOMETIMES USED FOR JUMBLE SALES, COFFEE MORNINGS, DISCOS, CONCERTS AND BADMINTON.
